s.text: That Bush cares about the people waiting outside the clinic makes you think he's a decent human being.

We hear at length about Bush's childhood reaction to his little sister's death from leukemia, his pole vault over the waiting list for the Texas Air National Guard in 1970, and his conversion from Wild Turkey to Cold Turkey in 1986.
In an interview excerpt, the Post reporters ask him whether it is true, as they heard from others, that during the Vietnam War, Bush argued on both sides of the issue.
This was a powerful hint that W. intends to tell Pat Robertson to go play in traffic.
This does not appear to be a convenient failure to recall opinions that have since become unpopular or embarrassing.
